node.title: The Winter Show, Postponed Because of Omicron Surge, Sets April Dates
node.alt: After being online-only in 2021, the Winter Show will be held in person in April at the former Barneys outpost.
node.description: One of New York City’s leading art fairs will be set on five floors of the former Barneys flagship location on Madison Avenue.
node.content: ["The Winter Show\u2019s 68th edition will run from April 1 through April 10 inside the former flagship location of Barneys New York at 660 Madison Avenue, the art fair\u2019s organizers announced Friday.", "The fair, which benefits the East Side House Settlement, a nonprofit organization serving the Bronx and Northern Manhattan, had been postponed in December because of the surge of the coronavirus pandemic. (It had been slated to be held in January at the Park Avenue Armory.) The fair went virtual for its 2021 edition, and this year, it will be in person and include some online viewing rooms.", "\u201cIt was disappointing to postpone, but we knew it was the right decision,\u201d Helen Allen, the executive director of the Winter Show, said in an interview.", "\u201cBut there is nothing as good as seeing artworks in person, and we are thrilled to have found a new venue,\u201d she added.", "The fair established itself in the 1950s as a leading venue for antiques buyers and later broadened its scope to fine art and design. Dealers are vetted by a committee and typically produce richly decorated booths, which separate them from the simple white walls synonymous with the contemporary art market.", "Allen said that the fair would be split across five floors inside the former department store and include 62 exhibitors. She said that while eight dealers who originally planned to attend the event had dropped out, they would participate in the fair virtually."]
